de.esoco.lib.json

Class JsonParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.json.JsonParser

  • public class JsonParser
extends java.lang.Object
    A parser for the JSON data that can also be used to parse the relations of Relatable objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonParser()
      Creates a new instance that parses the full hierarchy of a JSON string (limited to Short.MAX_VALUE).
      JsonParser(int nDepth)
      Creates a new instance that parses only a certain number of hierarchy levels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonParser

        public JsonParser()
        Creates a new instance that parses the full hierarchy of a JSON string (limited to Short.MAX_VALUE).

      • JsonParser

        public JsonParser(int nDepth)
        Creates a new instance that parses only a certain number of hierarchy levels. If the depth reaches zero all properties will be left as the original JSON strings. This can only be for parsing untyped data through methods like parse(String) or for providing typed objects (like relatables) with the correct string datatypes at the levels where the parsing is terminated if the maximum depth is reached.

        Limiting the depth allows to prevent unnecessary parsing if only sub-structures of JSON data need to be evaluated. For example, in JSON RPC requests and responses only the params and result properties are of interest and should be parsed. By parsing such a record with parseObject(String) or parseObjectMap(String) and a depth of 1 these properties can then be queried from the returned object as strings and parsed into a typed object.

        Parameters:
        nDepth - The maximum depth of properties to parse

    • Method Detail

      • parseJson

        public static Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parseJson()
        Returns a function that parses a JSON string into objects. The parsing is done by parse(String).
        Returns:
        A function that parses JSON string into objects

      • parseJson

        public static <T> Function<java.lang.String,T> parseJson(java.lang.Class<T> rDatatype)
        Returns a binary function that parses a JSON string into an Object with a certain datatype by invoking parse(String, Class).
        Parameters:
        rDatatype - The preset datatype for unary function invocation
        Returns:
        The parsing function

      • parseJsonArray

        public static <T> Function<java.lang.String,java.util.List<T>> parseJsonArray(java.lang.Class<T> rElementType)
        Returns a function that parses a JSON array into a list with a specific element type.
        Parameters:
        rElementType - The datatype of the list elements
        Returns:
        The parsing function

      • parseJsonMap

        public static Function<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> parseJsonMap()
        Returns a function that parses a JSON object and returns a map containing the parsed values. The returned map preserves the order of the parsed values in the input string.
        Returns:
        The parsing function

      • parse

        public java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String sJson)
        Parses a JSON string value according to it's JSON datatype. For more enhanced datatype parsing see parse(String, Class).
        Parameters:
        sJson - The JSON value string
        Returns:
        The parsed value (NULL if input is NULL or empty)
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not valid JSON

      • parse

        public <T> T parse(java.lang.String sJsonValue,
                   java.lang.Class<? extends T> rDatatype)
        Parses a JSON string value into a certain datatype.
        Parameters:
        sJsonValue - The JSON value string
        rDatatype - The target datatype
        Returns:
        The parsed value
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not valid JSON or doesn't match the given datatype

      • parseArray

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parseArray(java.lang.String sJsonArray)
        Parses the values from a JSON array into a list.
        Parameters:
        sJsonArray - The JSON array string
        Returns:
        A new list containing the parsed array values

      • parseArray

        public <C extends java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>> C parseArray(java.lang.String sJsonArray,
                                                                       C rTargetCollection)
        Parses a JSON array into an existing collection. The collection elements will be parsed by parse(String). For better control of the element datatype the method parseArray(String, Collection, Class) can be used.
        Parameters:
        sJsonArray - The JSON array string
        rTargetCollection - The target collection
        Returns:
        The input collection containing the parsed array values

      • parseArray

        public <T> java.util.List<T> parseArray(java.lang.String sJsonArray,
                                        java.lang.Class<T> rElementType)
        Parses the values from a JSON array into a collection with a specific datatype.
        Parameters:
        sJsonArray - The JSON array string
        rElementType - The data type of the collection elements
        Returns:
        The input collection containing the parsed array values

      • parseArray

        public <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> C parseArray(java.lang.String sJsonArray,
                                                          C rTargetCollection,
                                                          java.lang.Class<T> rElementType)
        Parses a JSON array into an existing collection of a certain datatype. The collection elements will be parsed by parse(String, Class).
        Parameters:
        sJsonArray - The JSON array string
        rTargetCollection - The target collection
        rElementType - The data type of the collection elements
        Returns:
        The input collection containing the parsed array values

        Returns:

      • parseObject

        public JsonObject parseObject(java.lang.String sJsonObject)
        Parses a JSON object structure into a JsonObject. This is the same as invoking JsonObject.fromJson(String) on the input string.
        Parameters:
        sJsonObject - The JSON object string
        Returns:
        A new map containing the parsed object attributes

      • parseObjectMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parseObjectMap(java.lang.String sJsonObject)
        Parses a JSON object structure into a map. The map will preserve the order in which the object attributes in the JSON string.
        Parameters:
        sJsonObject - The JSON object string
        Returns:
        A new map containing the parsed object attributes

      • parseRelatable

        public <R extends Relatable> R parseRelatable(java.lang.String sJsonObject,
                                              R rTarget)
        Parses a JSON object from a string into the relations of a relatable target object.
        Parameters:
        sJsonObject - sJson The string containing a JSON object
        rTarget - The relatable target object to set the parsed relations on
        Returns:
        The input relatable, containing the parsed relations
        See Also:
        parseRelation(String, Relatable)

      • parseRelation

        public void parseRelation(java.lang.String sJson,
                          Relatable rTarget)
        Parses a relation from a JSON string into Relatable object. The JSON input string must be in a compatible format as generated by the method JsonBuilder.appendRelations(Relatable, Collection) or else the parsing may cause errors. Furthermore all relation types referenced in the JSON must have their full namespace and must have been created as instances or else their lookup will fail.
        Parameters:
        sJson - The JSON input string
        rTarget - The related object to set the relation in
